headline: Wells Fargo Increases Exxon Mobil (XOM) Price Forecast, Maintains Bullish View
summary: Exxon Mobil Corporation (NYSE:XOM) is included among the Goldman Sachs Dividend Stocks: Top 14 Stock Picks. On February 24, Wells Fargo analyst Sam Margolin raised the price recommendation on Exxon Mobil Corporation (NYSE:XOM) to $183 from $156. He maintained an Overweight rating on the shares. The firm said Exxon’s stock has helped lead the broader […]

headline: How The Repligen (RGEN) Narrative Is Shifting With New Targets M&A Plans And Products
summary: The updated fair value for Repligen is set at US$190.89, with analysts treating this as a recalibration of their existing price target rather than a fresh reset. Bullish and bearish voices are split on how much this US$190.89 level really tells you about upside from here, especially given the different views on how dependable the underlying assumptions are. As you read on, you will see how these price target debates, along with recent company news, shape the evolving narrative around Repligen...

headline: Is Wells Fargo Stock Underperforming the Nasdaq?
summary: Wells Fargo has underperformed the Nasdaq Composite over the past year. However, Wall Street analysts remain moderately optimistic about its prospects.

headline: Wells Fargo & Company Announces Full Redemption of its Series BB Preferred Stock and Related Depositary Shares
summary: SAN FRANCISCO, February 25, 2026--Wells Fargo & Company (NYSE: WFC) today announced that on March 15, 2026 (which, due to the occurrence of a non-business day, will shift to March 16, 2026), it will redeem all 140,400 outstanding shares (the "Redeemed Series BB Preferred Shares") of its 3.90% Fixed Rate Reset Non-Cumulative Perpetual Class A Preferred Stock, Series BB (the "Series BB Preferred Stock"). headline: How The Workday (WDAY) Investment Story Is Shifting With AI Questions And Leadership Change
summary: Workday’s fair value estimate has been trimmed from US$263.60 to US$231.17, a reduction of around 12% that reflects updated views on the company’s risk and growth profile. This shift lines up with a broader reset across the analyst community, where many firms are lowering price targets and reassessing their stance in light of AI related uncertainty, slower bookings trends, and leadership changes. As you read on, you will see how these moving parts fit together and what to watch as the Workday...

headline: Jim Cramer's top 10 things to watch in the stock market Wednesday
summary: Workday's light guidance is sending the stock down big, and HP Inc. showed just how painful the memory-chip crisis is.

headline: Wells Fargo taps KeyBank alum to lead business banking
summary: Dennis Devine, former president of consumer banking at Key and ex-CEO of Alliant Credit Union, joined Wells on Monday as the bank looks to boost business after the lifting of a seven-year asset cap.
